description: From Middle English begripen, bigripen, from Old English begrīpan (“to grip, seize, lay hold of; chide”), from Proto-West Germanic *bigrīpan. Equivalent to be- (“around, about”) +‎ gripe.

verbs.description: begripe (third-person singular simple present begripes, present participle begriping, simple past and past participle begriped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To lay hold of; apprehend; grip; grasp.
examples: And as for this sword there shall never man begripe it at the handle but one, but he shall pass all other. In the name of God, said Percivale, I shall essay to handle it. So he set his hand to the sword, but he might not begripe it.
